MonitoringLocationIdentity.MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: The station is located on the TWELVEMILE MESA, COLORADO 1:24000 scale series topographic quadrangle. The site, described as a stream, was retrieved from the online USGS Open-File Report 97-492, 'National Geochemical Database, Reformatted Data from the National Uranium Resource Evaluation (NURE) Hydrogeochemical and Stream Sediment Reconnaissance (HSSR) Program' Version 1.4 (2006). The 'LASLID' (Los Alamos Scientific Laboratory Site Identification Number) field entry was used to create the Station Name.

THE SITE IS LOCATED ON THE GREAT DIVIDE; COLORADO-MOFFAT CO. 1:24000 SERIES USGS TOPOGRAPHIC QUADRANGLE. THE SITE IS LOCATED ON THE ELK RIVER AT THE HINMAN CAMPGROUND. THIS SITE IS NOT LOCATED WITHIN THE DINOSAUR NATIONAL MONUMENT'S BOUNDARY. DATA FOR THIS SITE ORIGINATE FROM THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE ROCKY MOUNTAIN REGIONAL OFFICE REPORT; `WATER QUALITY STUDIES AT CAPITOL REEF NATIONAL PARK AND DINOSAUR NATIONAL MONUMENT;` PREPARED BY ENVIROSPHERE COMPANY. FOR MORE INFORMATION CONTACT RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AT DINOSAUR NATIONAL MONUMENT 4545 HIGHWAY 40; DINOSAUR; CO 81610-9724. TEL (970)374-3000. DATA WERE PROCESSED AND UPLOADED TO STORET BY MARY BETH TALTY OF NPS-WRD FORT COLLINS CO 80525. TEL (970)225-3516.*** Legacy STORET Station Type: /TYPA/AMBNT/STREAM

OrganizationDescription.OrganizationFormalName: Colorado Dept. of Public Health & Environment

MonitoringLocationIdentity.MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: The site location was map interpolated based on the site name.

MonitoringLocationIdentity.MonitoringLocationName: MIDDLE FORK LITTLE SNAKE R. @ FS RD. 551
MonitoringLocationIdentity.MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Take Rd 129 North from Steamboat past the town of Columbine. Road will fork-take left fork and continue until you approach the 3 Forks Ranch house. Take the first right onto Forest Service Rd 551. Approximately, 0.2 miles is the bridge that crosses the stream. The site is upstream of the confluence with the North Fork.

MonitoringLocationIdentity.MonitoringLocationName: SOUTH FORK LITTLE SNAKE R ABV 129 RD. AT 3 FORKS RANCH

MonitoringLocationIdentity.MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Take 129 Rd North from Steamboat past the town of Columbine. Road will fork-take left fork and continue until you reach the 3 Forks Ranch house. Continue on Rd 129 until the road crosses the Little Snake River. Site is 5.8 miles from the entrance to the 3 Forks Ranch.

MonitoringLocationIdentity.MonitoringLocationName: LITTLE SNAKE R. BLW 129 RD. @ FOCUS RANCH
LITTLE SNAKE R. NR 129 RD. @ DOW PROP. WEST OF BATTLE CK
MonitoringLocationIdentity.MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: The station name and coordinates were taken from a spreadsheet used by CDPHE Biologist Lori Martin. Both may need to be checked since they place the site in Wyoming at the 129 Rd crossing of Battle Creek. The town of Battle Creek is to the southwest.

MonitoringLocationGeospatial.HorizontalCollectionMethodName: GPS Code (Pseudo Range) Standard Position (SA On)

MonitoringLocationIdentity.MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Travel to Baggs Wyoming via Hwy 13 and head East on highway pass the town of Slater approx. 20 miles to CR 129, turn right and sample w/ a bucket. Alternately in summer access via Hahns peak to avoid leaving the state.

MonitoringLocationGeospatial.HorizontalCollectionMethodName: GPS Code (Pseudo Range) Standard Position (SA Off)

MonitoringLocationIdentity.MonitoringLocationName: SLATER CK @ 1W RD. NEAR BRUSH MNT. LODGE
SLATER CK @ 1 RD NR USGS GAGE

MonitoringLocationIdentity.MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: From Steamboat Springs take Hwy 40 West to Hayden. Take Rd. 80 North. This road will change into Rd. 150. Continue on Rd. 150 until Rd. 154. Take a right and collect sample where road crosses creek.
Travel N. from Craig approx 45 miles to where Fourmile Cr. Goes under highway two miles South of the Wyoming line.

OrganizationDescription.OrganizationFormalName: The Rivers of Colorado Water Watch Network (RiverWatch)

MonitoringLocationIdentity.MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Go west of Craig approx 30 miles to the bridge near Maybell. Take Colorado 318 to mile marker 48. Turn left on Cty Rd 21 south. Go 7.5 miles to the bridge and then across the bridge. The sample is taken on the north side of the bridge.
